Package fr.umlv.baba

Class Board

java.lang.Object
fr.umlv.baba.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
Board is the representation of all the data of the game Baba Is You.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board​(int xMax, int yMax)
    Board is a hollow representation of the game, but it still needs dimensions.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void add​(Element element, int coord)
    add an element in a coord to the HashMap elements.
    void addAll​(Element element, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> listCoord)
    add an element in all the coords to the elements HashMap.
    void displayBoard​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics2D)
    Display the board with zen5.
    int getXMax()
    A getter to know xMax in Board.
    int getYMax()
    A getter to know yMax in Board.
    void initRules()
    Init the list of rules of the board.
    boolean isLoose()
    Check if no rule are defined with the YOU property.
    boolean isValid()
    Called with a start board.
    boolean isWin()
    Check if a YOU element is on a WIN element.
    void move​(int direction)
    Try to move everything in the board that can do it at a specific direction.
    void refreshRules()
    Refresh the rules in the board in two step. searching the current rules in the board and transform items concerned by "Name Property Name" rules.
    int switchDirection​(java.lang.String direction)
    translate a String direction to its integer value.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board​(int xMax, int yMax)
      Board is a hollow representation of the game, but it still needs dimensions.
      Parameters:
      xMax - Number of cases at length.
      yMax - Number of cases at height.

  • Method Details

    • getXMax

      public int getXMax()
      A getter to know xMax in Board.
      Returns:
      xMax

    • getYMax

      public int getYMax()
      A getter to know yMax in Board.
      Returns:
      yMax

    • displayBoard

      public void displayBoard​(java.awt.Graphics2D graphics2D)
      Display the board with zen5.
      Parameters:
      graphics2D - the graphics animation of zen5.

    • add

      public void add​(Element element, int coord)
      add an element in a coord to the HashMap elements.
      Parameters:
      element - The element to add.
      coord - The coord where is the element
      See Also:
      Element

    • addAll

      public void addAll​(Element element, java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> listCoord)
      add an element in all the coords to the elements HashMap.
      Parameters:
      element - The element to add.
      listCoord - The list of the coords where are the elements
      See Also:
      Element, Set, Integer

    • switchDirection

      public int switchDirection​(java.lang.String direction)
      translate a String direction to its integer value.
      Parameters:
      direction - A direction ("LEFT", "RIGHT", "UP", "DOWN").
      Returns:
      the integer to add to a coordinate to move it?
      See Also:
      String

    • move

      public void move​(int direction)
      Try to move everything in the board that can do it at a specific direction. Currently, only all the elements with the YOU property are allowed to move.
      Parameters:
      direction - A direction ("LEFT", "RIGHT", "UP", "DOWN").

    • isWin

      public boolean isWin()
      Check if a YOU element is on a WIN element. The game is won then.
      Returns:
      true if an element with YOU property contains a coordinate that an element with WIN property has..

    • isLoose

      public boolean isLoose()
      Check if no rule are defined with the YOU property. The game is lost then.
      Returns:
      true if no element in the rules has the YOU property.

    • initRules

      public void initRules()
      Init the list of rules of the board. The non-item elements (words) get the PUSH property.

    • refreshRules

      public void refreshRules()
      Refresh the rules in the board in two step. searching the current rules in the board and transform items concerned by "Name Property Name" rules.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Called with a start board. Check if a board is valid and respect all the conventions of "Baba Is You".
      Returns:
      true only if the board is valid.
